name: Last digit of an integer raised to the last digit of a factorial
description:
Given two numbers `a` and `b`, 
your job is to create the function `last(a,b)` which finds the last digit of `a` raised to the last digit of `b!`,
where b! = `b * (b - 1) * (b - 2) ... * 1` is the [factorial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Factorial) of b.

# Examples:
```javascript
last(5, 2) -> 5
last(10, 4) -> 0
```


# Input
`a` and `b` are both integers

# Output
You are trying to find the last digit of `a^(last digit of b!)`

--
